title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.8 - Executive Order No. 8: [Extending of enlistments in the New York Army and Air National Guards.]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.8 - Executive Order No. 8: [Extending of enlistments in the New York Army and Air National Guards.]
State Regulations
I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, by virtue of the authority
invested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State of New York, and
pursuant to Public Law
87-117, approved by the President of the United States
on August 1, 1961 and Executive Order of the President of the United States, Number 10957, dated August 16, 1961, and as Governor of the State of New York, do hereby direct by Executive Order as follows: (I)

All enlistments, re-enlistments and
voluntary extensions of enlistment in the New York Army National Guard which
expire at any time after 2400 hours September 30, 1961 and prior to 2400 hours

June 30, 1962 are hereby extended for a period of one year from their
respective dates of expiration, provided that nothing contained herein shall be
construed to prevent immediate voluntary re-enlistment under applicable laws
and regulations. (II)

All
enlistments, re-enlistments and voluntary extensions of enlistment in the New

York Air National Guard of persons whose enlistments, re-enlistments or
voluntary extensions of enlistment as Reserves of the Air Force have been
extended pursuant to Public Law
87-117, which expired at any time after 2400
hours August 17, 1961 and prior to 2400 hours June 30, 1962 are hereby extended
for a period of twelve months from their respective dates of expiration, provided that nothing contained herein shall be construed to prevent immediate
voluntary re-enlistment under applicable laws and regulations. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: September 26, 1961

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
1.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
